intro: Vernonanthura cuneifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf vernonanthura, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Vernonanthura cuneifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to Mediterranean climates.
